curriculum.title: K-12 AI-Integrated Computer Science Curriculum
curriculum.description: Comprehensive computer science and AI education program aligned with CBSE, ICSE, CSTA, and international standards

aiIntegration.philosophy: Age-appropriate introduction to AI concepts from kindergarten through high school, emphasizing ethical development and practical applications
aiIntegration.progression: From basic pattern recognition and smart helpers (K-2) to machine learning and AI project development (9-12)
aiIntegration.ethics: Embedded throughout all grade levels with increasing sophistication

earlyElementary.focus: Play-based learning, pattern recognition, introduction to smart helpers

lateElementary.focus: Block-based programming, basic algorithms, AI applications in daily life

middleSchool.focus: Computational thinking, text-based programming, AI ethics, data structures

highSchool.focus: Advanced programming, machine learning, AI project development, career preparation

lessons.title: Machine Learning Fundamentals and AI Projects

foundational.name: AI Awareness and Digital Literacy
foundational.description: Introduction to AI concepts through play, exploration, and basic programming
outcomes: Recognize AI in everyday devices and applications
Understand basic programming concepts through visual tools

intermediate.name: Computational Thinking and AI Applications
intermediate.description: Deeper exploration of programming, data, and AI ethics
outcomes: Apply computational thinking to solve complex problems
Understand data structures and their role in AI
Analyze bias and ethical issues in AI systems
Create programs that demonstrate AI concepts

advanced.name: AI Development and Innovation
advanced.description: Professional-level AI development, machine learning, and career preparation
outcomes: Build and train machine learning models
Understand AI industry practices and career paths

aiConcepts.K-2: Smart helpers, pattern recognition, simple instructions
aiConcepts.3-5: AI decision making, learning from examples, recommendations
aiConcepts.6-8: Data organization, algorithmic bias, privacy protection
aiConcepts.9-12: Machine learning, neural networks, AI development lifecycle

ethics.K-2: Helping vs. harmful technology, sharing and privacy
ethics.3-5: Fair treatment by AI, protecting personal information
ethics.6-8: Bias in AI systems, data privacy rights, algorithmic fairness
ethics.9-12: Professional AI ethics, societal impact, responsible development

dataLiteracy.3-5: Data collection, basic analysis, pattern recognition
dataLiteracy.6-8: Data structures, statistical concepts, bias in data
dataLiteracy.9-12: Advanced data analysis, machine learning datasets, data science methods

formative.focus: Understanding of concepts, problem-solving process, ethical reasoning

summative.focus: Application of skills, project completion, communication of learning

authentic.focus: Transfer of learning, professional skills, societal impact

international.unesco: AI and Education guidelines for ethical AI integration
international.oecd: AI competencies for the future workforce
international.ieee: Ethical design standards for AI systems

national.india: CBSE and ICSE computer science curriculum standards
national.usa: CSTA K-12 Computer Science Standards and state frameworks
national.uk: Computing curriculum and digital literacy requirements
national.singapore: Code for Fun and AI for Students initiatives

regional.adaptation: Curriculum can be adapted for local educational contexts and requirements
regional.localization: Examples and applications can be customized for regional relevance
regional.compliance: Framework supports compliance with local educational regulations
